com.mobilecoin.lib

Class MobileCoinClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mobilecoin.lib.MobileCoinClient

  • public class MobileCoinClient
extends Object
    High level client for MobileCoin blockchain

      • MobileCoinClient

        public MobileCoinClient(@NonNull
                        AccountKey accountKey,
                        @NonNull
                        android.net.Uri fogUri,
                        @NonNull
                        android.net.Uri consensusUri,
                        @NonNull
                        ClientConfig clientConfig)
                 throws InvalidUriException
        Construct new MobileCoinClient instance If the service URIs don't specify the ports explicitly, port 443 will be used by default.
        Parameters:
        accountKey - user's accountKey
        fogUri - a complete URI for the fog service
        consensusUri - a complete URI for the consensus service
        clientConfig - fog and blockchain services networking and attestation configuration
        Throws:
        InvalidUriException

      • getAccountSnapshot

        @Nullable
public AccountSnapshot getAccountSnapshot(UnsignedLong blockIndex)
                                             throws NetworkException,
                                                    InvalidFogResponse,
                                                    AttestationException
        Create an account snapshot for the provided block index.
        Parameters:
        blockIndex - is the index of the last block to include TxOuts from
        Returns:
        AccountSnapshot or null if the blockIndex is higher than what fog currently at and not equals to UnsignedLong.MAX_VALUE
        Throws:
        NetworkException
        InvalidFogResponse
        AttestationException

public PendingTransaction prepareTransaction(@NonNull

                                                      InvalidFogResponse,
                                                      AttestationException,
                                                      NetworkException,
                                                      TransactionBuilderException,

        Parameters:
        recipient - PublicAddress of the recipient
        amount - transaction amount
        fee - transaction fee (see estimateTotalFee(java.math.BigInteger, com.mobilecoin.lib.MobileCoinClient.FeeLevel))
        Returns:
        PendingTransaction which encapsulates the Transaction and Receipt objects

        InsufficientFundsException

        FeeRejectedException

      • getReceiptStatus

        @NonNull
public Receipt.Status getReceiptStatus(@NonNull
                                                Receipt receipt)
                                         throws InvalidFogResponse,
                                                NetworkException,
                                                AttestationException,
                                                InvalidReceiptException
        Check the status of the transaction receipt. Recipient's key is required to decode verification data, hence only the recipient of the transaction can verify receipts. Sender should use getTransactionStatus(Transaction transaction)
        Parameters:
        receipt - provided by the transaction sender to the recipient
        Returns:
        Receipt.Status
        Throws:
        InvalidFogResponse
        NetworkException
        AttestationException
        InvalidReceiptException

      • getTransactionStatus

        @NonNull
public Transaction.Status getTransactionStatus(@NonNull
                                                        Transaction transaction)
                                                 throws InvalidFogResponse,
                                                        InvalidTransactionException,
                                                        AttestationException,
                                                        NetworkException
        Check the status of the transaction. Sender's key is required to decode verification data, hence only the sender of the transaction can verify it's status. Recipients should use MobileCoinClient#getReceiptStatus(Receipt receipt )}
        Parameters:
        transaction - obtained from prepareTransaction(PublicAddress recipient, BigInteger amount, BigInteger fee)
        Returns:
        Transaction.Status
        Throws:
        InvalidFogResponse
        InvalidTransactionException
        AttestationException
        NetworkException

      • estimateTotalFee

        @NonNull
public BigInteger estimateTotalFee(@NonNull
                                            BigInteger amount,
                                            @NonNull
                                            MobileCoinClient.FeeLevel feeLevel)
                                     throws InsufficientFundsException,
                                            NetworkException,
                                            InvalidFogResponse,
                                            AttestationException
        The minimum fee required to send a transaction with the specified amount. The account balance consists of multiple coins, if there are no big enough coins to successfully send the transaction FragmentedAccountException will be thrown. The account needs to be defragmented in order to send the specified amount. See defragmentAccount(java.math.BigInteger, com.mobilecoin.lib.DefragmentationDelegate)
        Parameters:
        amount - an amount value in picoMob
        Throws:
        InsufficientFundsException
        NetworkException
        InvalidFogResponse
        AttestationException

      • estimateTotalFee

        @NonNull
public BigInteger estimateTotalFee(@NonNull
                                            BigInteger amount)
                                     throws InsufficientFundsException,
                                            NetworkException,
                                            AttestationException,
                                            InvalidFogResponse
        Throws:
        InsufficientFundsException
        NetworkException
        AttestationException
        InvalidFogResponse

      • defragmentAccount

        public void defragmentAccount(@NonNull
                              BigInteger amountToSend,
                              @NonNull
                              DefragmentationDelegate delegate)
                       throws InvalidFogResponse,
                              AttestationException,
                              NetworkException,
                              InsufficientFundsException,
                              TransactionBuilderException,
                              InvalidTransactionException,
                              FogReportException,
                              TimeoutException
        The account balance consists of multiple coins, if there are no big enough coins to successfully send transaction, the account needs to be defragmented. If the account is too fragmented, there may be a need to defragment the account more than once. However, wallet fragmentation is a rare occurrence since there is an internal mechanism to defragment the account during other operations.
        Parameters:
        delegate - monitors and controls the defragmentation process
        Throws:
        InvalidFogResponse
        AttestationException
        NetworkException
        InsufficientFundsException
        TransactionBuilderException
        InvalidTransactionException
        FogReportException
        TimeoutException

      • requiresDefragmentation

        public boolean requiresDefragmentation(@NonNull
                                       BigInteger amountToSend)
                                throws NetworkException,
                                       InvalidFogResponse,
                                       AttestationException,
                                       InsufficientFundsException
        Returns whether the defragmentation is required on the active account in order to send the specified amount
        Throws:
        NetworkException
        InvalidFogResponse
        AttestationException
        InsufficientFundsException

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Attempt to gracefully shutdown internal networking and threading services This is a blocking call which in rare cases may take up to 10 seconds to complete.
